featured.text: Often considered as representing the circle of life, hoops featured prominently in the ritual dances of Native Americans.
It was initially created as a type of dance and ritual.
Ten thousand saw I at a glance, Tossing their heads in sprightly dance.
The word “prom” was first used in the 1890s, referring to formal dances in which the guests of a party would display their fashions and dancing skills during the evening’s grand march.
The temple celebrated Mazu Festival by hosting ten days of lion dances, Taiwanese operas, and traditional hand ______ shows.

other.text: When I asked if she was angry about what she had lost, she admitted to being frustrated occasionally, “especially when everybody’s dancing, because I love to dance.
Couples danced to music provided by a local amateur band or a record player.
Many areas will also organize bon-odori dances.
If you do not dance, you cannot establish relationships.
Beside the lake, beneath the trees, Fluttering and dancing in the breeze.
The term “hula,” however, did not enter the English language until the 1700s, when British sailors first witnessed hula dancing in the Hawaiian Islands.
Though no hoops were used, the movements of the ritual dances looked very similar to those in hooping.
34 Originally dedicated to the deceased, the dances have now become a symbol of the summer festival themselves.
Participants, often dressed in light cotton kimonos, are encouraged to dance to the music around the stage.
Capoeiristas learned to camouflage the forbidden fights with singing, clapping, and dancing as though it were simply entertainment.
The style of the dances varies from region to region but is normally based on the rhythms of taiko drums.

definition.zh_def: 舞蹈；以音樂為伴隨的身體動作，通常表達情感或故事。
definition.en_def: A series of rhythmic movements performed to music, often expressing emotions or telling a story.
definition.example: She loves to dance at parties.
